title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 12 June 2014 - XWiki

08:48 <spawn57\_> hi, I'm trying to build a simple html ui that creates a new page. I want to check if the page exists first using ajax.  Can someone recommend how I can do this?  
08:57 <tmortagne> spawn57\_: the best for performance is probably to do a REST request and check if HTTP code is not 404  
08:57 <tmortagne> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/XWikiRESTfulAPI#HPageresources  
08:58 <spawn57\_> tmortagne: thanks, that what I was thinking.  Learning prototype now.  
08:58 <tmortagne> either that or a usual URL but with /get/ instead of /view/  
08:59 <tmortagne> (get action does not execute the skin and is not stored in statistics among other things)  
08:59 <tmortagne> but I thin REST is the quickest  
08:59 <tmortagne> \*think

09:43 <mflorea> tmortagne: extension tests are failing and I couldn't create a new wiki on a recent snapshot of 6.1 because the UI install didn't work (I haven't investigates to see why)  
09:49 <tmortagne> mflorea: checking  
09:50 <tmortagne> how recent was the XE you tested ? maybe there was some stuff missing if it was yesterday  
09:52 <tmortagne> mflorea: what is weird is that the ui test we have related to wiki creation seems to build well  
09:53 <mflorea> it didn't work for me, but I'll check with the latest snapshot  
09:53 <tmortagne> (xwiki-platform-wiki-test-tests)  
09:53 <tmortagne> well it build on jenkins at least  
09:53 <tmortagne> but xwiki-platform-wiki-test-tests is not a full XE, maybe there is some other module creating issue

16:00 <vierfzweievieraz> hi there! how to not get in a loop with the event listener in java? by removing the event with observation.removeEvent(getName(), event)?  
16:01 <tmortagne> vierfzweievieraz: why a loop ?  
16:03 <vierfzweievieraz> imlements EventListener -> onEvent (DocumentUpdatedEvent) -> (manipulate content and call xwiki.saveDocument(document, context)  ) - event calls the eventListener again...  
16:04 <tmortagne> don't do that  
16:04 <vierfzweievieraz> what exactly?  
16:04 <tmortagne> listen to DocumentUpdatingEvent, modify the passed XWikiDocument and let XWiki save it for you  
16:05 <tmortagne> you should also make sure to modify the document only if needed (if you were you would not have a loop)  
16:05 <vierfzweievieraz> how can i let xwiki do that for me?  
16:05 <tmortagne> DocumentUpdatingEvent is notified before the document is saved  
16:06 <tmortagne> so it will be saved  
16:06 <tmortagne> you don't have anything to do  
16:06 <tmortagne> the idea here is to modify it right before it's saved  
16:06 <vierfzweievieraz> so just call setDocument? that's it?  
16:06 <tmortagne> I don't know any setDocument  
16:06 <vmassol> Lyes: how is it going? :)  
16:06 <tmortagne> the first parameter of the event comming with DocumentUpdatingEvent is the XWikiDocument that is going to be saved  
16:07 <tmortagne> just modify it  
16:07 <vmassol> Lyes: on my side I'm testing the scripting API ATM  
16:07 <vmassol> (between conf calls ;))  
16:07 <vierfzweievieraz> my fault i meant document.setContent(xdom)  
16:07 <tmortagne> yes  
16:07 <tmortagne> just that  
16:08 <tmortagne> but make sure you modify the document passed with the even and not to get the document from XWiki class  
16:08 <vierfzweievieraz> alright  
16:09 <Lyes> @vincent: on my side i'm on the test of creating html body part with embedded images  
16:09 <vmassol> Lyes: any problem? do you need help?  
16:09 <vmassol> Lyes: btw you should check my integration test  
16:09 <tmortagne> vierfzweievieraz: by the way DocumentUpdatingEvent may not be enough, you probably need to listen DocumentCreatingEvent no ?  
16:09 <vmassol> I used the Part.writeTo() api  
16:10 <vierfzweievieraz> it worked just fine, thank you!  
16:13 <Lyes> @vincent: I also use Part.writeTo() api  
16:15 <vierfzweievieraz> you are right, i am going to need the createdevent also... thax again  
16:18 <vierfzweievieraz> \*thanks  
16:28 <vierfzweievieraz> has quit  
16:28 <kaisen> If I found a "bug" in the MoccaCalender what is the best way to report it?  
16:29 <vmassol> in jira  
16:29 <tmortagne> kaisen: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/MOCCACAL  
16:29 <kaisen> Ahh ok thanks ;-)  
16:30 <vmassol> something that could be interesting to integrate in some future: https://github.com/jdorn/json-editor (not sure yet what would be the best integration)  
16:38 <OSIMasson> has quit  
17:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'd like to release a first version of the new mail module tomorrow in 6.1M2; is that ok? Sending email  
17:03 <tmortagne> nothing is going to use it by default in 6.1M2 ? it's just an experimental feature that someone can try ?  
17:03 <vmassol> yes  
17:03 <tmortagne> then I don't see why not  
17:03 <vmassol> the idea is to refactor our code to use over time  
17:06 <vmassol> I was asking because of the timining  
17:06 <vmassol> and since you're now the RM for 6.1M2 ;)  
17:06 <tmortagne> I don't plan to release today if that's the question  
17:07 <vmassol> yes that was another way of putting the question indeed ;-) (today and tomorrow morning)

18:06 <cjd> vmassol: Fabio just showed me this: http://facebook.github.io/buck/  
18:06 <cjd> I was looking to see if it's used anywhere, looks like gerrit has moved from maven  
18:08 <cjd> I really have no idea whether it has the critical repository aspect but it's pretty interesting nonetheless  
18:09 <cjd> Apparently it was made by ex-googlers who cloned google's secret-sauce build system when they went to facebook  
18:12 <vmassol> thanks cjd  
18:12 <vmassol> for the link  
18:13 <cjd> yeah, it's exciting to see a heavyweight moving in on this problem
